titleInfo.title: Williams v. Barberton City School District Board of Education
titleInfo.subTitle: Order Adopting Magistrate Judge Limbert's 7 Interim Report and Recommendation and Denying 3 Motion for default judgment filed by Kelli Williams and Denying as Moot 10 Motion to strike and/or Motion to stay filed by Kelli Williams. This case continues to be referred to Magistrate Judge Limbert for general pre-trial supervision. Judge David D. Dowd, Jr. on 1/13/2012. (M,De)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 5:11-cv-02514; Williams v. Barberton City School District Board of Education;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Northern District of Ohio
extension.docketText: Order Adopting Magistrate Judge Limbert's 7 Interim Report and Recommendation and Denying 3 Motion for default judgment filed by Kelli Williams and Denying as Moot 10 Motion to strike and/or Motion to stay filed by Kelli Williams. This case continues to be referred to Magistrate Judge Limbert for general pre-trial supervision. Judge David D. Dowd, Jr. on 1/13/2012. (M,De)

titleInfo.title: Williams v. Barberton City School District Board of Education
titleInfo.subTitle: Report and Recommendation: It is recommended that the Court grant defendant's motion for judgment on the pleadings, as plaintiff has failed to allege sufficient facts to fulfill the Garcetti requirement for her public employee First Amendment claim, and, in the alternative, that she has also failed to allege sufficient facts to demonstrate that her alleged protected speech was a substantial or motivating factor in her termination (Related document 23). Signed by Magistrate Judge George J. Limbert on 9/27/12. (S,AA)

Signed by Magistrate Judge George J. Limbert on 9/27/12. (S,AA)

titleInfo.title: Williams v. Barberton City School District Board of Education
titleInfo.subTitle: Memorandum Opinion scheduling an oral argument with respect to 35 plaintiff's objections to the 33 Report and Recommendation of the Magistrate Judge and schedules the oral argument for 11/8/2012 at 10:00 a.m. Judge David D. Dowd, Jr. on 10/25/2012. (S,He)

titleInfo.title: Williams v. Barberton City School District Board of Education
titleInfo.subTitle: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Plaintiff's Motion to file an amended complaint (See Document ECF#28 Plaintiff's Objections). The grant of the motion to amend renders moot the Defendant's 23 Motion for Judgment on the Pleadings, the Magistrate Judge's Report and Recommendation and the Plaintiff's Objections thereto. Plaintiff shall file a First Amended Complaint no later than December 21, 2012. Defendant shall have until January 4, 2013 to file a responsive pleading. Rule 12 motions will not be entertained, but any arguments that were asserted in Defendant's Motion for Judgment on the Pleadings may be reasserted in a Rule 56 motion. All dates set in the August 28, 2012 Order (Dkt.#32) remain in effect. Signed by Judge David D. Dowd, Jr. on 11/30/2012.(M,De)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 5:11-cv-02514; Williams v. Barberton City School District Board of Education;

extension.docketText: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Plaintiff's Motion to file an amended complaint (See Document ECF#28 Plaintiff's Objections). The grant of the motion to amend renders moot the Defendant's 23 Motion for Judgment on the Pleadings, the Magistrate Judge's Report and Recommendation and the Plaintiff's Objections thereto. Plaintiff shall file a First Amended Complaint no later than December 21, 2012. Defendant shall have until January 4, 2013 to file a responsive pleading. Rule 12 motions will not be entertained, but any arguments that were asserted in Defendant's Motion for Judgment on the Pleadings may be reasserted in a Rule 56 motion. All dates set in the August 28, 2012 Order (Dkt.#32) remain in effect. Signed by Judge David D. Dowd, Jr. on 11/30/2012.(M,De)
